responsibilities: Ensure customer success via successful implementation and support of Carbon Robotics Equipment.
Own, schedule, and prioritize maintenance tasks on the LaserWeeders.
Train operators and farm personnel to successfully implement the use of Carbon Robotics equipment.
Serve as the lead point of contact for assigned accounts.
Learn and teach every facet of equipment usage, from transportation and maintenance to field utilization and operation.
Schedule, coordinate, and prioritize bi-weekly maintenance tasks on Slayers in collaboration with the support team.
Own the quality of work and PM scheduling.
Report immediately to Support and Ops Management teams any event, condition, or circumstance that could injure another employee, damage equipment, reduce customer confidence, or impair service.
Make recommendations to improve support processes and Slayer reliability.
Troubleshoot and report weeding quality issues in collaboration with support.
Maintain positive working relations with all support stakeholders.
Plan, organize, schedule, and supervise work activities.
Develop knowledge of Slayer and all associated systems.
Attend and participate in meetings related to support and Slayer performance.
Enhance the image and reputation of Carbon Robotics by ensuring FST teams have necessary resources to execute tasks at a high level.
Provide high-quality training to incoming FSTs.
qualifications: Strong understanding of electrical and mechanical systems.
Ability to read and interpret electrical diagrams.
Ability to clearly communicate over different platforms with a large set of stakeholders.
Ability to manage multiple projects and solve an array of technical, personnel, and customer-related problems.
Ability to clearly document issues and processes.
analysis:
The job responsibilities and skills listed are primarily focused on the implementation, maintenance, and support of Carbon Robotics equipment, specifically the LaserWeeders and Slayers. The responsibilities include tasks such as scheduling maintenance, training operators, troubleshooting equipment issues, and ensuring customer success. The skills required include understanding electrical and mechanical systems, reading electrical diagrams, and managing multiple projects.

There is no mention of Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The job seems to be more related to technical support and equipment management rather than working with AI technologies. The focus is on hardware and operational tasks rather than software or AI development.

Therefore, based on the provided information, this job does not involve working with Generative AI or language models.
